result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy W. Loucks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy W. Loucks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy W. Loucks was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy W. Loucks

records.addlTxt: Reminder notice.
Order to Amend to Ordinance.

Stipulation to Amend.
The State moves to amend count 2 to county ordinance disorderly conduct, contrary to Manitowoc County Ordinance 6.19.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss count 1.  Motion granted.
The Court imposes a $100.00 forfeiture plus costs, total of $330.50, to be paid by 11-30-22 or 7 days county jail for failure to pay.

10:53 am - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy W. Loucks in court. Attorney Luke Harrison appeared by video for Jeremy W. Loucks. Not guilty pleas.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Scheduling conference on October 26, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Further proceedings on September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order on Stipulation to Modify Condition of Bond.
It is hereby ordered that, based on the stipulation of the parties, the signature bond for the defendant be amended to allow for non-assaultive contact with R.L.B.
Stipulation to Modify Bail Conditions.
Letter from defendant re: no contact condition of bail.
Letter from Jeremy Loucks
Bail/bond hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Victim Identification Key.
RE:  Battery-dvo, on 07-03-22.
Prints ordered (TRPD)

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 07-05-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-28-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that the defendant provide an address to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 48 hours of release and that he have no contact with R.L.B., DOB: 03-27-1980 or the residence at 1404 22nd Street, Two Rivers, WI.  The Court will allow a one time contact with the residence, with the aid of law enforcement, after the 72 hour no contact provision has expired, to obtain personal belongings.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at TRPD.
Minutes.
